name: Snowpilot
headline: The connected spreadsheet that destroys data silos
description:
Snowpilot combines a spreadsheet UI with a federated data engine. We get live data from tools like Salesforce, Gong, and Mixpanel, enabling PMs, marketers, and salespeople to run high-impact workflows with data at any scale.

Ben and Dom met at a Sequoia & a16z-backed data startup, Census. Together, we built the first real-time, warehouse-native customer data platform. Prior to that, Dom led 20+ ML engineers at Adobe to build their internal ad optimization platform, which allocates $1B in annual spend. Ben built the microservices stack powering the new Microsoft Edge, scaling from 0 to hundreds of millions of DAUs.

We started coding Snowpilot in mid-August '24, and we already have a live app that can run sub-second queries on millions of rows, entirely in the user's browser.

The data warehouse market is $10B/yr, growing 23% YOY. We will disrupt incumbents and significantly expand this market by enabling non-engineers to use big data on a daily basis.

**Company Overview: Snowpilot**

Snowpilot is a burgeoning startup located in the heart of San Francisco, founded in 2024 by Ben and Dom, two veterans from the data-centric cloud landscape. Their mission? To break down data silos with a connected spreadsheet that empowers users, particularly product managers, marketers, and sales teams, to leverage big data effortlessly. 

The platform marries a friendly spreadsheet interface with a powerful federated data engine that pulls live data from tools like Salesforce, Gong, and Mixpanel. This seamless integration allows users to execute high-impact workflows without the usual complexities associated with big data analytics. 

**Founders’ Background:**
Ben and Dom's partnership blossomed at Census, a data startup backed by heavyweights like Sequoia and a16z, where they laid the foundation for a real-time, warehouse-native customer data platform. Each brings a stellar pedigree to Snowpilot: Dom has extensive experience in machine learning from his time at Adobe, where he led a team to create an ad optimization platform capable of managing a billion-dollar budget. Meanwhile, Ben developed the microservices that powered Microsoft Edge, scaling it from zero to hundreds of millions of daily active users.

**What They’ve Built:**
Since kicking off development in August 2024, Snowpilot has already delivered a live application capable of executing sub-second queries on millions of rows—all in the user’s browser. That's a major feat, especially given the typical hurdles associated with real-time data processing.

**Market Opportunity:**
Snowpilot enters a competitive landscape, looking to disrupt the $10 billion data warehouse market, which is currently growing at an impressive 23% year over year. Their focus is on democratizing access to big data, enabling not just engineers but everyday users to tap into sophisticated data analytics.

As a participant in Y Combinator's Batch S24, Snowpilot is poised for rapid growth and innovation. Despite having a lean team of just two, with Aaron Epstein as their Group Partner, they demonstrate a clear commitment to scalability and impact.

If you’re interested in how Snowpilot is redefining data accessibility, check out their website at [snowpilot.com](https://www.snowpilot.com). It’s clear that they are on an exciting trajectory to revolutionize the way businesses interact with data.
